intro: Psephellus geghamensis, commonly known as the Armenian sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Armenia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a compact growth form with upright stems and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
